column4: Why do I get a "Permission denied" when trying to run a game server?  It's in my user's folder.
for one thing, if the game server wanted to use low network sockets, your normal user would be prohibited from doing so
Not sure what low network sockets are, but how do I get around it if that is the case?
you can't - start the server as root
many "server" services need to be run as root regardless
How do I log into root when it's disabled?
you never "log into root" - you run a program *as* root, with sudo
I did try that, not sure if it was done correctly though!  I got into the correct folder and typed sudo ./server-bin and it returns a different error...command not found.
I did that in Terminal.  Is that correct place to be?
how would I know ? I don't know what you're trying to run
It's a game server, America's Army.
never seen it, is it linux native ? don't you need to setup a config before running the server ?
No, it was just unzipped to a folder.  I have had it running on other versions of Linux, but having trouble here.
did you run it as user there, too ? then strace it and see what happens
ubuntu is by default a lot less forgiving than other linux distro's, where one tends to do these things as root
I'm sorry, I have no idea what strace is.
strace ./server-bin spit out a lot of stuff.  Should I post it here or IM?  I was using root in other versions of Linux.
if you were using root in other versions of Linux then the best you could do is enable the root account, but I would not normally recommend that - better SUID the server binary
What is the command for that?
